title: Cards
data:
***Version [0.29](/0.29 "0.29")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

**Cards** are a distinct set of abilities used by followers of [Nemelex Xobeh](/Nemelex_Xobeh "Nemelex Xobeh") (or invoked against you by Nemelex's [wrath](/Divine_retribution "Divine retribution")).

## Contents

- [1 Decks](#Decks)

- [2 Power](#Power)

- [3 Lists of cards](#Lists_of_cards)

  - [3.1 Currently available cards](#Currently_available_cards)
  - [3.2 Removed cards](#Removed_cards)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 See also](#See_also)

## Decks

There are 3 player drawn decks: the [deck of destruction](/Deck_of_destruction "Deck of destruction"), [deck of escape](/Deck_of_escape "Deck of escape"), and [deck of summoning](/Deck_of_summoning "Deck of summoning"). While worshipping Nemelex, the god will occasionally [gift](/Gift "Gift") you cards. You can see the deck which the cards were dealt, but not specific cards themselves (at least, without using an ability). You can store a maximum of 26 cards for the deck of destruction, and 13 cards for the other two. Nemelex draws from the [deck of punishment](/Deck_of_punishment "Deck of punishment") as [divine retribution](/Divine_retribution "Divine retribution").

## Power

There are two aspects to the potency of a card's effect: called "power" and "power\_level" in the source code.

*Power* is the card equivalent to [spellpower](/Spellpower "Spellpower"). Players draw cards at `power = (9 × Invocations) + (1.5 × piety) + (piety × (Invocations + 25) / 27)`. Cards drawn by wrath have a power of `18 × XL`.

Most cards then translate power into *power level*, a number ranging from 0, 1, or 2. Each level can be considered a new "tier", and may add new effects or simply improve the card; for example, [the Orb](/Orb_card "Orb card") fires multiple orbs of destruction at power level 2. Every time a card is drawn, the game rolls twice: `power / 900` and `power / 2700` - each successful roll raises power level by 1.

## Lists of cards

### Currently available cards

| Destruction                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          | Escape                                                                                                                                                                                         | Summoning                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | Punishment                                                                                                                                               |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [Degeneration](/Degeneration_card "Degeneration card") [the Orb](/Orb_card "Orb card") [Pain](/Pain_card "Pain card") [the Storm](/Storm_card "Storm card") [Wild Magic](/Wild_Magic_card "Wild Magic card") [Vitriol](/Vitriol_card "Vitriol card") | [the Cloud](/Cloud_card "Cloud card") [the Elixir](/Elixir_card "Elixir card") [Exile](/Exile_card "Exile card") [the Tomb](/Tomb_card "Tomb card") [Velocity](/Velocity_card "Velocity card") | [the Dance](/Dance_card "Dance card") [the Elements](/Elements_card "Elements card") [the Illusion](/Illusion_card "Illusion card") [the Pentagram](/Pentagram_card "Pentagram card") [the Rangers](/Rangers_card "Rangers card") [Swarm](/Swarm_card "Swarm card") | [the Swine](/Swine_card "Swine card") [Torment](/Torment_card "Torment card") [the Wraith](/Wraith_card "Wraith card") [Wrath](/Wrath_card "Wrath card") |

***

- [Water](/Water_card "Water card")

## History

- Prior to [0.23](/0.23 "0.23"), decks were evocable items with different tiers, and card power and power level depended on the quality of the deck.
- Prior to [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), there were many more decks, many more cards, decks could be found on the floor, and card power scaled off Evocations with and without Nemelex.

## See also

[Decks](/Decks "Decks")

html:
Cards

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.29: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

Cards are a distinct set of abilities used by followers of Nemelex Xobeh (or invoked against you by Nemelex's wrath).

Contents

  • 1 Decks
  • 2 Power
  • 3 Lists of cards
    • 3.1 Currently available cards
    • 3.2 Removed cards
  • 4 History
  • 5 See also

Decks

There are 3 player drawn decks: the deck of destruction, deck of escape, and deck of summoning. While worshipping Nemelex, the god will occasionally gift you cards. You can see the deck which the cards were dealt, but not specific cards themselves (at least, without using an ability). You can store a maximum of 26 cards for the deck of destruction, and 13 cards for the other two. Nemelex draws from the deck of punishment as divine retribution.

Power

There are two aspects to the potency of a card's effect: called "power" and "power_level" in the source code.

Power is the card equivalent to spellpower. Players draw cards at power = (9 × Invocations) + (1.5 × piety) + (piety × (Invocations + 25) / 27). Cards drawn by wrath have a power of 18 × XL.

Most cards then translate power into power level, a number ranging from 0, 1, or 2. Each level can be considered a new "tier", and may add new effects or simply improve the card; for example, the Orb fires multiple orbs of destruction at power level 2. Every time a card is drawn, the game rolls twice: power / 900 and power / 2700 - each successful roll raises power level by 1.

History

  • Prior to 0.23, decks were evocable items with different tiers, and card power and power level depended on the quality of the deck.
  • Prior to 0.19, there were many more decks, many more cards, decks could be found on the floor, and card power scaled off Evocations with and without Nemelex.

See also

Deck of escape The Cloud • The Elixir • Exile • The Tomb • Velocity
Deck of summoning The Dance • The Elements • The Illusion • The Swarm • The Pentagram • The Rangers
Deck of punishment Swine • Torment • Wraith • Wrath

While worshipping Nemelex, the god will occasionally [[gift]] you cards. You can see the deck which the cards were dealt, but not specific cards themselves (at least, without using an ability). You can store a maximum of 26 cards for the deck of destruction, and 13 cards for the other two. Nemelex draws from the [[deck of punishment]] as [[divine retribution]]. ==Power== There are two aspects to the potency of a card's effect: called "power" and "power_level" in the source code. ''Power'' is the card equivalent to [[spellpower]]. Players draw cards at power = (9 × Invocations) + (1.5 × piety) + (piety × (Invocations + 25) / 27). Cards drawn by wrath have a power of 18 × XL. Most cards then translate power into ''power level'', a number ranging from 0, 1, or 2. Each level can be considered a new "tier", and may add new effects or simply improve the card; for example, [[Orb card|the Orb]] fires multiple orbs of destruction at power level 2.
